page.title: 04Fountain Violet Farm.
page.content: Fountain Violet Farm is situated East of Kingswear,very close to the village.It is a mixed farm and quite small,enjoying beautiful views over the Dart.The farm has fine buildings arranged around a central courtyard.It has a small herd of 32 Friesian and Jersey cows,which are milked in a parlour of 5 stalls.There are 16 heifer calves and 14 bullocks. The cattle graze on the hilly pastures,which are far too steep for crop-growing.As the farm is so small,land is rented at Hill Head for 40 breeding ewes.About 30 free-range hens are kept in a henhouse behind the farmhouse,eggs are sold locally.The flatter land is used for winter and spring barley.Up to Victorian times it was called Mouth Farm,but 2 spinster farmers changed it to Fountain Violet.
